question: Carl has 5 £50 bills. He buys six puzzles for £6 each. He also buys 7 packs of candy bars for £8 each. How much money does he have left?
answer:
Carl starts off with 5 * £50 = £<<5*50=250>>250.
Carl spends 6*£6 = £<<6*6=36>>36 on puzzles.
Carl spends 7 packs of candy bars * £8 = £<<7*8=56>>56 on candy bars.
Total Carl has spent £36 + £56 = £<<36+56=92>>92.
Carl has £250 - £92 = £<<250-92=158>>158 remaining.
#### 158
